description: This Kotlin source file defines the 'HomeBrowseFragment' class, which implements the home screen UI for an Android TV app using Leanback components. It manages static and dynamic rows of content, including featured content, categories, and live TV, along with custom card presentation styles.

classes.name: HomeBrowseFragment
classes.description: A fragment representing the home screen of an Android TV app, featuring categorized content rows and handling user interactions.

classes.name: SimpleCard
classes.description: A data class representing a simple card with a title and subtitle used for placeholder or static items.

classes.name: CardPresenter
classes.description: A custom Presenter class for rendering content cards with rounded corners, focus effects, gradient overlays, and text labels.

classes.name: HomeViewModel
classes.description: A placeholder ViewModel class for the home screen, currently empty.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the fragment, sets up UI styling, static rows, and loads dynamic content.

methods.name: buildStaticRows
methods.description: Creates static rows such as Settings/Developer options.

methods.name: loadDynamicRows
methods.description: Loads categorized dynamic content asynchronously via repository calls.

methods.name: onItemClicked
methods.description: Handles click events on content items and static cards, navigating to corresponding activities.

methods.name: onItemSelected
methods.description: Handles item selection events (currently a no-op).

methods.name: onCreateViewHolder
methods.description: Creates and returns a view holder for a content card, with focus and styling.

methods.name: onBindViewHolder
methods.description: Binds data to the card view holder based on the item type.

methods.name: onUnbindViewHolder
methods.description: Placeholder for cleanup when view holder is unbound.
